instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on one side, 5v on another side.
threads.message:
Cant find any liquid on the board.
At the start there was short on PPBUS and UB300 was getting hot. 
Replaced and short is gone but on that side got 5V and 0.25A. Just in case replaced <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> one more time but same issue.
On another side 20V and around 1A.

There is Apple logo, no progress bar but after 15 seconds fans spins at max and its restarts (it stays at 20V but current drop to 0.08A)

On that side with 5V both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> got correct LDOs in diode mode.
Test 5V with USBC tester and all readings are correct.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on one side, 5v on another side.
threads.message:
Check UB090 traces and surrounding components.
Try to reflash it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V on one side, 5v on another side.
threads.message:
Traces from UB090 to the rest of components are good.

Reflash of UB090 helped.
All works fine :) Again maaany thanks :)
